info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 02 at 3:25PM EST until February 04 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible. Total sleet and snow accumulations of 7 or more inches possible, except 6 inches of snow and sleet possible in the Berkshires and southern Vermont and ice accumulations a light glaze to two tenths of an inch possible. * WHERE...Southern Vermont, the Berkshires of western Massachusetts, the Greater Capital Region, northern and central Taconics, the Glens Falls and northern Saratoga Region, and the Upper reaches of the mid Hudson Valley including eastern Green and Columbia Counties. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The mixed precipitation may to heavy snow across the Capital Region into the northern and central Taconics and into southern Vermont and the Berkshires Thursday night into Friday morning with snowfall rates on an inch an hour.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
